author: djrtwo
content: (1) the secret must in fact be secret during the time period  that blocks were signed with a slash for early reveal, otherwise you can outsource this job "for free"

author: djrtwo
content: and thus you need the reveal and later public checking

author: djrtwo
content: (2) committee based confirmations are for confirming data into the beacon chain. The bit being correct or not does not signal the correctness of the data for each validator but instead is a crypto-economic guarantee that the committee validators honestly did their job (way before the key is revealed)

author: djrtwo
content: (4) yes, whatever "commitment" is being used for blocks, hash or kzg

author: djrtwo
content: (5) attestations are the primary message that conveys what the validator sees as the state of the work. in the future, attesters are assigned not only to a slot for beacon attestation but also to a shard to signal what the data is in the shard. the PoC/shard vote is contained in the attestation

author: djrtwo
content: so attestations are the vehicle for the custody commitment (block data and custody bit)

author: djrtwo
content: we rely upon aggreagtion of attestations for an efficient protocol. we only aggregate attesations with the exact same data ("like" attesttions)

author: djrtwo
content: if you have 8 bits, then you now have 8 possible attestations for teh same underlying data so you reduce aggregatability by a factor of 8

author: djrtwo
content: and yes, you will catch consistently lying validators faster but in expectation, the lazy validator is going to trip up in a few epochs even with a single bit
